preamble.longtitle: An Act to provide for the payment of grants for certain purposes connected with farm businesses or with the conversion of agricultural land to woodlands; and to increase the limit on the number of members of the Development Commission.
preamble.enactment: Be it enacted by the Queen's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.The appropriate authority may, with the approval of the Treasury, by scheme provide in relation to any one or more parts of Great Britain for the payment by the appropriate Minister of grants towards expenditure which—
Grants in respect of farm businesses.has been or is to be incurred for the purposes of, in connection with or in connection with any proposals for—

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.the establishment or expansion of a farm business of such a description as may be specified in the scheme;

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.the establishment or expansion, for purposes connected with the establishment, expansion or carrying on of such a farm business, of any agricultural business;

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.the promotion of such a farm business; or

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.the marketing of anything produced or supplied in the course of such a farm business;
Grants in respect of farm businesses.and

Grants in respect of farm businesses.appears to the appropriate Minister to be neither expenditure of a capital nature nor expenditure which would fall to be treated for the purposes of section 29 of the [1970 c. 40.] Agriculture Act 1970 as incurred in connection with expenditure of a capital nature.
Grants in respect of farm businesses.Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1) above, a scheme under this section providing for the payment of grants may—
Grants in respect of farm businesses.impose requirements to be complied with by persons applying for the grants;
Grants in respect of farm businesses.confer a discretion on the appropriate Minister as to the payment of the grants, as to the manner and timing of their payment and as to their amounts;

Grants in respect of farm businesses.provide for the grants to be paid to persons on such terms as may be specified in or determined under the scheme and for the modification of any such terms in such manner as may be so specified or determined;

Grants in respect of farm businesses.provide for the terms on which the grants are paid to impose such requirements on the persons to whom they are paid, including requirements to be complied with after the payment of the grants and requirements as to the repayment of grants, as may be so specified or determined;

Grants in respect of farm businesses.provide for any discretion conferred by or under the scheme to be exercisable in such circumstances and by reference to such matters, and the opinion of such persons, as may be so specified or determined;
Grants in respect of farm businesses.contain such supplemental, consequential and transitional provision as the appropriate authority thinks fit; and
Grants in respect of farm businesses.make different provision for different cases.

Grants in respect of farm businesses.The power to make a scheme under this section shall be exercisable by statutory instrument subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.
Grants in respect of farm businesses.A grant paid by virtue of a scheme under this section shall be paid out of money provided by Parliament.
Grants in respect of farm businesses.In this section—
Grants in respect of farm businesses."agricultural business" means a business consisting in, or such part of a business as consists in, the pursuit of agriculture;
Grants in respect of farm businesses."agriculture"—

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.in relation to England and Wales, has the same meaning as in the [1947 c. 48.] Agriculture Act 1947; and

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.in relation to Scotland, has the same meaning as in the [1948 c. 45.] Agriculture (Scotland) Act 1948;

Grants in respect of farm businesses."the appropriate authority", in relation to any scheme, means the appropriate Minister for the part of Great Britain to which the scheme extends or, if it extends to more than one part, the appropriate Minister for each part to which it does extend, acting jointly;
Grants in respect of farm businesses."the appropriate Minister"—

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.in relation to England, means the Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food; and

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.in relation to Scotland or Wales, means the Secretary of State;
Grants in respect of farm businesses."farm business" means any business consisting in, or such part of any business as consists in, a business which—

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.is carried on by a person who also carries on an agricultural business at the same time and on the same or adjacent land; and

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm businesses.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm businesses.is not itself an agricultural business.

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm woodlands.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm woodlands.The appropriate authority may, with the approval of the Treasury, by scheme provide in relation to any one or more parts of Great Britain for the payment by the appropriate Minister to the owners and lessees of land of—

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.grants towards expenditure which has been or is to be incurred for the purposes of, or in connection with, the conversion of land from agricultural use to use for woodlands or the management of land that has been so converted;
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.grants for abating any financial loss which has been or will be suffered in consequence of the conversion of land from agricultural use to use for woodlands.
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.Without prejudice to the generality of the preceding provisions of this section, a scheme under this section providing for the payment of grants may—
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.impose requirements to be complied with by persons applying for the grants;
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.confer a discretion on the appropriate Minister as to the payment of the grants, as to the manner and timing of their payment and as to their amounts;
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.provide for the persons to whom the grants are payable to include persons who become owners or lessees of land after its conversion to use for woodlands;

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.provide for the grants to be paid to persons on such terms as may be specified in or determined under the scheme and for the modification of any such terms in such manner as may be so specified or determined;

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.provide for the terms on which the grants are paid to impose such requirements on the persons to whom they are paid, including requirements to be complied with after the payment of the grants and requirements as to the repayment of grants, as may be so specified or determined;

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.provide for any discretion conferred by or under the scheme to be exercisable in such circumstances and by reference to such matters, and the opinion of such persons, as may be so specified or determined;
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.contain such supplemental, consequential and transitional provision as the appropriate authority thinks fit; and
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.make different provision for different cases.

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.Where the Secretary of State and the Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food jointly carry out a review of the rates at which grants are payable under any schemes for the time being in force under this section, the Secretary of State and that Minister may lay a report before Parliament stating—
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.whether, as a result of the review, they propose that any modifications of those rates should be made; and
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.the modifications, if any, that are proposed;

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.and it shall be the duty of the Secretary of State and that Minister to ensure that such a review is carried out, and a report under this subsection is laid before Parliament, no later than 30th September 1991 and that no more than five years elapse after the laying of a report under this subsection before another such review is carried out and another such report is so laid.

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.The power to make a scheme under this section shall be exercisable by statutory instrument and such a scheme shall not be made unless a draft of it has been laid before, and approved by resolution of, each House of Parliament.
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.A grant paid by virtue of a scheme under this section shall be paid out of money provided by Parliament.
Grants in respect of farm woodlands.In this section—
Grants in respect of farm woodlands."agricultural use"—

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm woodlands.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm woodlands.in relation to England and Wales, means agricultural use within the meaning of the [1947 c. 48.] Agriculture Act 1947, other than use for woodlands; and

leaf.margin: Grants in respect of farm woodlands.

content.leaf: Grants in respect of farm woodlands.in relation to Scotland, means agricultural use within the meaning of the [1948 c. 45.] Agriculture (Scotland) Act 1948, other than use for woodlands;
Grants in respect of farm woodlands."the appropriate authority" and "the appropriate Minister" have the same meanings as in section 1 above.

Grants in respect of farm woodlands.Nothing in this section or in any scheme under this section shall prejudice the power of the Forestry Commissioners to pay grants under section 1 of the [1979 c. 21.] Forestry Act 1979.

Membership of Development Commission.In paragraph 2(1) of Schedule 1 to the [1983 c. 29.] Miscellaneous Financial Provisions Act 1983 (composition of the Development Commission), for the word "eight" there shall be substituted the word "twelve".
Supplemental provisions.This Act may be cited as the Farm Land and Rural Development Act 1988.

Supplemental provisions.It is hereby declared that any function conferred on a Minister of the Crown by or under section 1 or 2 of this Act is to be treated as a function connected with agriculture for the purposes of section 17 of the [1986 c. 49.] Agriculture Act 1986 (duty to balance interests when exercising functions connected with agriculture).

Supplemental provisions.An Order in Council under paragraph 1(1)(b) of Schedule 1 to the [1974 c. 28.] Northern Ireland Act 1974 (exercise of legislative functions for Northern Ireland) which states that it is made only for purposes corresponding to the purposes of section 1 above—
Supplemental provisions.shall not be subject to paragraph 1(4) and (5) of that Schedule (affirmative resolution procedure and procedure in cases of urgency); but
Supplemental provisions.shall be subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.
Supplemental provisions.Sections 1 to 3 above do not extend to Northern Ireland.
